content: As of September 2021, there are 118 known chemical elements. The most recent element to be officially recognized is tennessine, which was named in 2016. These elements are arranged in the periodic table, which is a tabular arrangement of the elements based on their atomic structures and chemical properties. Each element is represented by a unique chemical symbol, and they are classified into different categories based on their properties, such as metals, nonmetals, and metalloids.
